intro: Fagelia terniflora, commonly known as the three-leaved fagelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. Fagelia terniflora produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
